attributes.action: Religious holidays should not affect your attendance at educational institutes
attributes.background: Those in educational establishments should be afforded a day off for a major religious festival (eg; Eid, Diwali) without this going against their attendance percentage. 100% attendance should still be achievable in these circumstances.

attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

Also article 3' will see the law change to make it easy for the UK's young to vote by allowing temp registration.

attributes.background: Privately owned property should have the right to refuse anyone the right to walk on their land

attributes.action: To remove the copyright laws in communal rooms in sheltered housing .

attributes.action: Government to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018 on joining the European Union
attributes.background: People who previously advocated leaving the EU had their voice heard in a call for a referendum. In fairness, -but also in terms of observing democratic principles-, the people who (now) advocate to join the EU should also have their voice heard in their call for a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned, ask this Government (or its successive Government) to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018, on joining the European Union, asking the people of the United Kingdom to choose between the following two options: ‘Join the EU’ or ‘Remain out of the EU’.

attributes.action: Increase the Council Tax band values for England to acceptable & relevant levels
attributes.background:
Council Tax valuations are based on the value of properties.

The value is the price the property would have sold for on the open market on 1 April 1991 in England and 1 April 2003 in Wales. Properties were put into a band based on their value on those dates.
attributes.additional_details:
Current Council Tax bands in England (1 April 1991 values)
Band / Value
A	up to £40,000 
B	£40,001 to £52,000
C	£52,001 to £68,000
D	£68,001 to £88,000
E	£88,001 to £120,000
F	£120,001 to £160,000
G	£160,001 to £320,000
H	more than £320,000

https://www.gov.uk

The bands were set in 1991 when house prices were 1/4 of today's value.  Anyone moving house today unfairly falls in to band F,G or H and pays between £2400-£3600 in Tax. The Values/Band should now be quadrupled in line with house prices.

attributes.action: Change Education Sector Staff Holidays to normal annual leave arrangements.
attributes.background: As this is paid for through public moneys including full pay through 7 or 8 weeks summer holidays this should be modernised to a annual leave policy in line with modern practices. The pupil breaks could see local and national improvement groups for education or indeed local school policy works.

attributes.background: It is the tabloid press that have been responsible for mis informing the public regarding Brexit.  Their xenophobic views are polluting the minds of the majority of the population. The economy will suffer as a result of this, therefore this is a way of supporting the British economy

This was the sole reason England failed to beat Iceland.  Evidence is the bilge they have printed for the last 6 months, which is resulting in minorities of the population being targeted across the country.  Reference all the Murdoch press and other tabloid toilet paper

I've been a van driver for as long as I can remember.
And it just seems mad that a van has to do 50mph on a A road .

Cause more accidents as cars can do 60mph and get impatient and do dangerous overtaking.

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using both lanes on the 2 lane carriageway A1m,To stop congestion
attributes.background: There is chronic delays on the 2 carriageway A1m by HGV's overtaking HGV's forcing all traffic to 40-50 mph which leads to stood traffic at five lane ends & ferrybridge

attributes.action: Allow students aged 16+ whose parents receive financial aid to gain employment.
attributes.background: Students who's parents receive financial aid from the governments benefits system should be allowed to gain employment as they currently are not. If a parent or career receives benefits then the house hold income must stay the same to what is provided by the government.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing students to gain employment it allows them to learn financial sustainability and also gives them vital work experience which is widely needed to gain future employment. I am a 17 year old student who has to volunteer to use up spare time as I cant gain employment. I would like to earn my own money but cant due to legal reasons. Even if I could only earn a certain amount would be better than none. So please help me with this petition and sign and share to gain work rights for students

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action: Raise maximum sentencing on those committing vile racism offences on citizens.
attributes.background: After recent events in the UK, a wave of hatred and racism has overshadowed the democracy to leave the EU. 100's of crimes of online and physical racism have been carried out particularly on EU citizens. With a new future for the country ahead, we need to stamp out this evil with increased severity.
attributes.additional_details: I can speak for the majority of people from both sides of the recent EU referendum who will condemn these vile attacks. Our country should be applauded and renowned for its diversity. Any form of racism against any citizen of any country residing in the UK should be deplored, and an increase in judicial sentencing on such crimes should be approved. Regardless of what world we live in, the UK should welcome all that arrive in this great democracy.

attributes.background: I work in hospitality, and have realised that the people working in hotels are overworked and very underpaid. But not only in this industry, lorry drivers, security guards shopworkers, every industry.

attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.

attributes.action: Only leave EU after an agreement in principle ensuring zero tariff barriers.
attributes.background:
There is  need to ensure the UK has access to the European single market without suffering tariffs.

I believe tariffs will lead to job losses in automotive, aerospace and other manufacturing industries.

attributes.action: If circumstances call for a second EU referendum, voting should be compulsory.
attributes.background:
If another referendum happens but with a similar, or worse, lower turnout - what validates the second result anymore than the first result? 
Australia uses compulsory voting every general election as it delivers a strong mandate for government. 100% turnout would ensure public respect for results.
attributes.additional_details:
As there is already an £80 fine in place for failing to register on the electoral roll, an £80 for failing to turn up to vote is not much of a further stretch. 

Voters remain free to spoil ballots, or not mark a preference, as a form of protest voting - they simply have to turn up. 

We have a few months before David Cameron resigns and athe least a year or so before we REALLY leave the EU. So many have expressed regret for voting out.. the future is still salvageable, but we have to act fast.

attributes.action: Add political history and international relations to the school curriculum.
attributes.background: A small number of people knew about how a democracy works at the end of the EU referendum. Even fewer understood what benefits the eu gave and the cost of having it. By adding how Britain creates and maintains relationships and political ideologies to the curriculum we should increase that number.
attributes.additional_details: I think evidence for the need for politics to be added is the large number of people asking for a second referendum because it didn't go their way. These people clearly do not know how a democracy works and they should. There also needs to be teaching into the benefits of international relations and the benefits each nation gives to the UK as well as how those relationships are formed and maintained.I propose they are added into PSHE lessons before the end of formal secondary education at 16.

attributes.action: Criminalise politicians and the media for lying, misleading or misinforming.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was the biggest decision in modern history. But the decision made was based on lies, misinformation and speculation. We need an independent body with the power to impose legal repercussions on politicians and media organisations for circulating misleading or untrue claims.
attributes.additional_details:
Gisela Stuart, Boris Johnson and Michael Gove said: 
"After we Vote Leave, there won’t be a sudden change that disrupts the economy." Yet the Brexit vote triggered the biggest fall in the pound in history.
Nigel Farage disowns Vote Leave '£350m for the NHS pledge' hours after EU referendum result. Also, the £350 million figure was deemed 'misleading' (UK Statistics Authority). 
The Sun published "The Queen backs Brexit" - Buckingham Palace complained to IPSO about this claim.

attributes.action: Increase the HM Government Petition Response and Action Commitment
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to recognise the scale of opinion over lawful and reasonable public interest matters with the provision of additional petition signature number milestones.
attributes.additional_details: It is proposed that a parliamentary debate is held for petitions achieving 1 million signatures and positive change is instigated for petitions achieving 10 million signatures.

attributes.action: Negotiate with EU to allow UK/EU passports to give full EU passage until expired
attributes.background: UK passport holders need the right of passage within existing EU territories using our UK/EU passport in the same way as we use Pre Referendum

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.

attributes.action: UK referendums to last a minimum of ten years, before repeating.
attributes.background: Scottish independence and EU referendum results to remain law for a minimum of ten years, along with any others which may follow.

attributes.action: Unite the country! An enquiry into the existing divide in the voting class
attributes.background: The UK on the 23rd June 2016 voted to leave the EU. The country had prior to, been subjected to scaremongering, distortion of facts and in general a politics filled with hate, divide and manipulation.
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of the vote, we awoke to a country on the verge on a breakup, with calls for a 2nd EU Referendum, a petition for the declaration of London's  independence and of course the call for a 2nd Scottish Referendum. We believe there is an urgent need for the UK Parliament to act and to prioritise the need to unite the country.We urge Parliament to examine the cause of the stark divide in society as reflected by the results of the EU Referendum by setting up a panel of enquiry.

attributes.action: Reduce sewage pollution on UK beaches - abolish OFWAT.
attributes.background: Every year millions of cubic meters of sewage laden waters end up in our rivers and on beaches. The current regulations are monitoring and reporting driven and fail to focus on proactive reduction of spills. OFWAT is a regulator that is obsessed with price reduction and fails to tackle this issue
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. has a large number of beaches that are classified as having poor water quality and many others are inadequately monitored at all.
Sewage and hospital waste contained within are often found within shellfish and bathing water samples. All could be reduced through investment in storage capacity and real time control rather than the current monitoring.
We truly need to forget the political sensitivity of the price of water and allow price increases to permit investment

attributes.action: Give Bristol, Cambridge and other remain areas the chance to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Scotland and London have significantly voted to remain. As such actions are being taken to protect their democratic decision. 

Other parts of the UK have also strongly voted to remain and in any devolution options should have the option to join the parts of the UK that choose to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are securing their right to have a 2nd referendum and London has a petition going strongly.

Certain areas and cities have overwhelmingly voted to remain in the EU, including Gibraltar, Northern Ireland, Manchester, Oxford, Brighton and more. These areas should not have their British identity stripped in devolution without choosing what their new identity will be.

attributes.action: Hold a Second EU Referendum for all 11 to 18 Year olds and combine the totals
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Vote held on Thursday 23rd of June 2016, was not democratic and failed to provide all people the vital information required to make an informed decision and most importantly failed to involve the most important people whose very futures depend on the vote
